titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Susan Howe Papers
titlestmt.author: by Leigh Golden and Jennifer Meehan

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday May 2, 2019 at 03:06

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of material created and accumulated by Susan Howe in the course of her activities as a poet, author, and teacher, and primarily documents Howe's literary career from 1998 to 2008. Material includes correspondence with poets, authors, artists, and musicians; drafts and manuscripts of published poetry collections, including The Midnight, Kidnapped, and Pierce-Arrow, and other writings; notebooks and diaries; teaching and research material; artwork; and family and personal papers.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Granary Books on the Elizabeth Wakeman Dwight Memorial Fund, 2009.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 31(electronic document): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 21-30 (Series IV: Art Work): Restricted fragile material. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
Box 32 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Susan Howe Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Susan Howe Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collection, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This collection received a basic level of processing at the time that it was acquired by the library. Material has been rehoused in acid-free boxes and, when necessary, acid-free folders, and has been organized into series based on the way in which the collection was organized upon receipt by the library. Where feasible, material has been left in original folders and titles have been transcribed from original folders. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing. Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Susan Howe
bioghist.p: Susan Howe was born in 1937 in Boston, Massachusetts. She is the author of several books of poems and two volumes of criticism. Her poetry collections include: The Midnight (2003), Kidnapped (2002), The Europe of Trusts (2002), Pierce-Arrow (1999), Frame Structures: Early Poems 1974-1979 (1996), The Nonconformist's Memorial (1993), The Europe of Trusts: Selected Poems (1990), and Singularities (1990).

Since 1989 she has been a professor of English at the State University of New York at Buffalo, and is currently the Samuel P. Capen Chair of Poetry and the Humanities. She was elected a Chancellor of The Academy of American Poets in 2000. Susan Howe lives in Guilford, Connecticut.
Biographical information is drawn from Poets.org.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of material created and accumulated by Susan Howe in the course of her activities as a poet, author, and teacher, and primarily documents Howe's literary career from 1998 to 2008. Material includes correspondence with poets, authors, artists, and musicians; drafts and manuscripts of published poetry collections, including The Midnight, Kidnapped, and Pierce-Arrow, and other writings; notebooks and diaries; teaching and research material; artwork; and family and personal papers. Correspondents include: Rae Armantrout, Dennis Barone, Samuel Beckett, Susan Bee, Charles Bernstein, Anne Carson, Norma Cole, Robert Creeley, Simon Cutts, Rachel Blau DuPlessis, Alec Finlay, Dominique Fourcade, Lyn Hejinian, Fanny Howe, Devin Johnston, J. C. C. Mays, Maureen Owen, Michael Palmer, Kristin Prevallet, Bernard Rival, Leslie Scalapino, Susan Stewart, Cole Swensen, John Taggart, Erica Van Horn, Rosmarie Waldrop, and Elizabeth Willis.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into six series: I. Correspondence, 1956-2008. II. Writings, 1894-2007. III. Notebooks and Diaries, 1984-2007. IV. Professional Papers, 1961-2007. V. Family and Personal Papers, circa 1916-2001. VI. Art Work, 1958-1973.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into two subseries: General Correspondence and Email Correspondence (printouts). Correspondents overlap between the two subseries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically according to correspondent, reflecting the order in which the material was received by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes an obituary for Susan Howe's maternal grandmother, Susan Manning, pasted onto an end sheet; a dedication to Susan Howe from her mother, Mary (n Manning) Howe; various marginal notes and ephemera; a letter which has been inserted into the book block; a newspaper photo of Samuel Beckett which has been tipped in; and a photograph assumed to be of Susan Howe's grandmother, Susan Manning, dated 1931.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The material found within this subseries is organized chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series consists of teaching material (including annotated books), seminars, research material, reviews of Susan Howe's books, scholarly writing on Susan Howe's work, and interviews with Susan Howe. Also included are an NEA application and information regarding permissions, jurying, travel, reading and awards.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files have been left in the order in which they were received by the library.

odd.p: File titles have been transcribed from the original folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series consists of family papers remaining after the death of Howe's mother including photographs, documents, and letters (with several written by Howe) as well as a photocopy typescript of an autobiographical work written by Howe's mother, which, among other things, deals with the Poet's Theater in Boston. Also included are printouts of email correspondence between Howe and her late husband Peter Hare, November 1999 March 2001, and photographs and other material relating to her late husband David von Schlegell.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a pocket address book, a older photograph of George Gilmore, two U.S. Passports for Mary Manning Adams and a 1999 wall calendar entitled "The Personal Photo Calendar: Exclusively Designed for You."

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: In-process material. As of January, 2019, this collection is closed to readers temporarily, and will reopen when conservation treatment is complete.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into eight groups by the artist.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The groups of drawings, the order of the groups, and the order of individual sheets within the groups was determined by Susan Howe in January 2019; titles of groups, where titled, are taken from her notes at this time. For identification purposes, where words are present the artworks are listed by the first word or several words that appear near the top or left of the sheet, and/or by the most prominent word.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Drawings and word drawings by Susan Howe, watercolor, collage, graphite, and pen-and-ink, chiefly made in Ireland and New York in the 1970s and 1980s. Also includes a drawing by Howe of a hotel interior, Achill Island, Ireland, in 1959; two drawings by Jonathan Shahn, of Howe and Henry Geldzahler, circa 1960; and a cover design by and poster for an exhibit of David von Schlegell.
